content.text:
# List of national monuments of Pakistan

Following are the monuments of national importance of Pakistan, declared or constructed as such:
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-siz0; text-align:left; line-height:150%;"
|-
! Name
! Location
! class="unsortable"| Description
! class="unsortable"| Image
! class="unsortable"| Reference
|-
| Tomb of Allama Iqbal
| Lahore, Punjab
|Mausoleum of Allama Iqbal, the national poet of Pakistan. Built in 1951.
| align="center" |
|
|-
| Wazir Mansion
| Karachi, Sindh
|Birthplace of Muhammad Ali Jinnah, the founder of Pakistan. Declared in 1953.
| align="center" |
|
|-
| Minar-e-Pakistan
| Lahore, Punjab
|Built in 1968 to commemorate the site where the Lahore Resolution was passed.
| align="center" |
|
|-
| Mazar-e-Quaid
| Karachi, Sindh
|Mausoleum of Muhammad Ali Jinnah. Built in 1971.
| align="center" |
|
|-
|  Ziarat Residency
| Ziarat, Balochistan
| Last residency of Muhammad Ali Jinnah. Declared in 1975.
| align="center" |
|
|-
|Allama Iqbal Museum
|Lahore, Punjab
|House of Allama Iqbal. Declared in 1977.
| align="center" |
|
|-
| House of Abdus Salam
|  Jhang, Punjab
|House of Abdus Salam, Pakistan's first Nobel laureate in Physics. Declared in 1981.
|
|
|-
| Quaid-e-Azam House Museum
| Karachi, Sindh
|House of Muhammad Ali Jinnah. Declared in 1985.
| align="center" |
|
|-
| Faisal Mosque
| Islamabad, Pakistan
|National mosque of Pakistan. Built in 1986.
| align="center" |
|
|-
|  Pakistan Monument
| Islamabad
|Built in 2007 as the national monument.
| align="center" |
|
|-
|}
References
